ETYMOLOGY: From Middle English male, from Old French masle (modern French mâle), from Latin masculus, diminutive of mās ('a male, man').

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: a word (other than a pronoun) used to identify any of a class of people, places, or things, or to name a particular one of these
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: An individual belonging to the sex that produces sperm; a boy or man, or a male animal.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 属于能够产生精子的性别的个体；雄性动物或男性。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: The zoo recently acquired a rare male white tiger for breeding.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 这家动物园最近购得一只稀有的雄性白虎用于繁殖。

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: a word or phrase naming an attribute, added to or grammatically related to a noun to modify or describe it
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: Relating to or denoting the sex that is capable of fathering offspring; masculine.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 与能够生育后代的性别相关的；男性的；雄性的。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: He felt pressure to conform to traditional male stereotypes.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 他感到有压力去迎合传统的男性刻板印象。

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: a word or phrase naming an attribute, added to or grammatically related to a noun to modify or describe it
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: (Botany) Having stamens (pollen-producing organs) but lacking pistils (seed-bearing organs); staminate.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: (植物学) 雄性的；有雄蕊的（不带雌蕊的）。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: The palm tree is dioecious, requiring a separate male plant to pollinate the female trees.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 这种棕榈树是雌雄异株的，需要单独的雄株来为雌株授粉。
